msbt.message: My hometown is waaaaay out in the middle of nowhere.I remember one friend was all like, "I hate the country! I wanna be an actress!" Then she skipped town.Word is she's making a name for herself playing country girls. I hear she's loving it, !
Growing up in a rural town was kinda lonely I could walk for miles and never see anyone else.That's kinda why I shipped out to . I wanted to chill with my buds without the hour walk!

Growing up in the country was reallyquiet and calm.I used to cut class to chill with friends, and stay up way too late just to watch the stars.My neighbors were these two old ladies who just loooved to yell at me, but even that was kinda fun.They were REALLY scary sometimes, though.

UghI totally forgot to water the flowers my dad got me for my birthday. Go me, right?I really shoulda been more careful. But at least they left a ton of seeds behind, .I'm gonna replant 'em, and this time they're gonna flourish, or my name's not !

My favorite flowers look like they're trying to wither again I guess sometimes you just get unlucky.I did a buncha research last time this happened. I think if I trim the husks and keep watering, they'll be fine.If your flowers ever wither, you gotta do everything you can! Never give up, !

A while back, I got super busy and forgot to water my flowers for, like, a week. The poor things wilted!But I didn't give up. I stayed on it, kept caring for 'em, and get this they bounced back!That's how I know my flowers have got spirit, !
I feel like I'm always staying up waaaay too late.

Like, I'll say I'm gonna get to bed early, but then I'll be reading a book or somethingAnd then I gotta know what happens next so I keep turning pagesAnd pretty soon I'm near the end so I figure I may as well finishAnd suddenly the sun's up!

Whenever I say "OK, tonight I gotta go to bed early!", my friend calls. Every single time!So it's likenow what? If they need help, that's important. Or if they just wanna chat, that's important too!Oh well! That's what coffee's for, right ?

I like to toss on my headphones at night and dance to some tunes.But sometimes the rhythm gets to me, and I start rockin' out like I'm at a concert, screamin' like YEEEAAAH!And there's just no calming down after that, y'know? I'm probably driving my neighbors nuts
My mom sent some fruit from home the other day. I thought I'd eaten enough for two lifetimesBut the minute I opened the box and that smell hit me So many memories, y'know?
Think I'll send her basket. Gonna give my parents a taste of the local flavor!
It was such a blast of nostalgia. So much stuff I'd forgottenaaand a few things I wish stayed forgotten!
I love knowing I've got a home to go back to if I need it. It's why I'm cool with living out here alone.
I love kids! I know I don't look it, but I was an awesome babysitter back in the day.
Kids are so curious that it's kinda inspiring. They'd ask a million questions and I'd be clueless!It made me wanna learn more just so I could answer 'em, !
The little tots were always runnin' circles around me. But you just can't top those smiles, .It really tired me out. It was kinda great, though.
I loved watching the rug rats grow. Yeah, they'd be rude sometimes, but who am I to judge? Bwa ha ha!

Why doesn't anyone believe me when I talk about how much I love flowers?Is it the way I dress? The way I talk? It's really getting annoying.Hey, do me a solid and spread the word that I love flowersand that I don't care if that shocks anyone!Seriously, why's everyone always so surprised?

I talked to my mom on the phone the other day. There are some BIZARRE rumors about me back home.Did you know I moved here to fight a giant sea monster? Neither did I!First, I haven't seen a single sea monster here. Second, what do they expect me do? Hurl insults at it?It's almost as weird as that rumor where I moved to the moon to focus on . Likehuh?!I mean, is on the moon evenpossible?
